text: Patricia Eva "Bonnie" Pointer (July 11, 1950 â€“ June 8, 2020) was an American singer. She is most notable for being a member of the R&B; singing group The Pointer Sisters. She also had her own solo hits after leaving the group in 1977. Her disco cover of The Elgins' "Heaven Must Have Sent You" became a U.S. Top 20 pop hit in 1979. She was born in Oakland, California. On June 8, 2020, Pointer died due to cardiac arrest in Los Angeles. She was 69. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1950 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American R&B; singers Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:Singers from Oakland, California
title: Bonnie Pointer
